title: Contract wins boost revenue at services supplier Carillion

Wed, Aug 26, 2015, 09:14 BST - UK Markets close in 7 hrs 16 mins Contract wins boost revenue at services supplier Carillion Telegraph – 20 minutes ago 0.0001 0.0000 
Business gained in 2014 helped deliver a 21pc revenue boost for the FTSE 250 construction and services group 
A strong set of new contracts won in the last year has delivered bumper revenue for Carillion (Other OTC: CIOIF - news ) , the support services and construction group. 
Revenue at the FTSE 250 company rose 21pc to £2.26bn for the six months to June 30, it said on Wednesday, thanks to the “exceptional volume of new contracts won in 2014”. 
However pre-tax profits were flat at £67.5m as Carillion absorbed the “substantial costs of mobilising new contracts”, and a fall in margin in its construction business. 
Stripping out one-off costs, underlying profits climbed 16pc to £112.5m. 
New (KOSDAQ: 160550.KQ - news ) contract wins in 2015 were £1bn, down from £3.2bn a year earlier, a fall Carillion blamed on a pause in government contract awards due to the general election. 
However, the company still has £17.1bn in secure orders as of June 30, versus £18.6bn at the end of 2014. Its pipeline of contract opportunities also grew to £40.5bn, up from £39.2bn six months ago. 
"I am pleased to report that Carillion has continued to perform in line with expectations, which reflects the actions we took during the economic downturn to position our businesses in markets where we can now achieve revenue growth, consistent with our targets for margins and cash flow,” said Philip Green, chairman. 
“We have also made good progress with mobilising a number of major new contracts won in 2014. Therefore, with a strong order book, a growing pipeline of contract opportunities and the prospect of market conditions continuing to improve, our expectations for 2015 and the medium term remain unchanged." 
The company said it would raise its interim dividend by 2pc to 5.7p. 
In July, Carillion secured an £80m contract to build an operational base and accommodation complex for BP's Khazzan gas project in Oman. It (Other OTC: ITGL - news ) is also working on a £75m extension to Liverpool FC’s Anfield Stadium .
